title: Transpose of sparse tensor Variables no longer works in 0.3
body_html:
Sparse tensor Variables seem to no longer support the transpose operation.

import torch
i = torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1], [2, 0, 2]])
v = torch.FloatTensor([3, 4, 5])
sparse_mat = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(i, v, torch.Size([2,3]))
sparse_mat.t()

This code will run. However, if we wrap sparse_mat in a variable...

from torch.autograd import Variable
sparse_var = Variable(sparse_mat)
sparse_var.t()

This code returns the following error:

RuntimeError: t is not implemented for type torch.sparse.FloatTensor

This code was working just fine before upgrading to 0.3.
body_text:
Sparse tensor Variables seem to no longer support the transpose operation.
import torch
i = torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1], [2, 0, 2]])
v = torch.FloatTensor([3, 4, 5])
sparse_mat = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(i, v, torch.Size([2,3]))
sparse_mat.t()
This code will run. However, if we wrap sparse_mat in a variable...
from torch.autograd import Variable
sparse_var = Variable(sparse_mat)
sparse_var.t()
This code returns the following error:
RuntimeError: t is not implemented for type torch.sparse.FloatTensor
This code was working just fine before upgrading to 0.3.
body:
Sparse tensor Variables seem to no longer support the transpose operation.

```python
import torch
i = torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1], [2, 0, 2]])
v = torch.FloatTensor([3, 4, 5])
sparse_mat = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(i, v, torch.Size([2,3]))
sparse_mat.t()
```

This code will run. However, if we wrap `sparse_mat` in a variable...

```python
from torch.autograd import Variable
sparse_var = Variable(sparse_mat)
sparse_var.t()
```

This code returns the following error:

`RuntimeError: t is not implemented for type torch.sparse.FloatTensor`

This code was working just fine before upgrading to 0.3.
